    Docs and Samples

    Download code samples to get started with Windows on Devices. Also, read docs to help you use tools and resources to help you develop.


    Did you set up your environment?

    We assume you already set up your environment, have a working Visual Studio and have a device running Windows IoT Core (MinnowBoard Max, Raspberry Pi 2, or VM).


    Questions/Suggestions

    Remember, you can always send contact us for help and suggestions!

    • Docs and Tutorials

    • Samples

    On-Device Command-line Utilities

    A set of tools available on your device to help you configure a slew of options

    Learn More

    Windows 10 IoT Core Insider Preview Porting Tool

    A tool for helping you port your existing Win32 and Windows CE applications to Windows 10 IoT Core

    Learn More

    Using PowerShell

    Allows Remote Administration and Configuration so that you can remotely configure and manage any Windows IoT Core device

    Learn More

    Using SSH

    Allows Remote Administration and Configuration of your Windows IoT Core device over SSH

    Learn More

    Hardware Pin Mappings

    Pinout and interfacing information for GPIO, SPI, and I2C

    Raspberry Pi 2 Pinout
    MinnowBoard Max Pinout

    AllJoyn Connectivity

    Learn more about AllJoyn and explore the capabilities of the AllJoyn Device System Bridge with Windows 10 IoT Core Insider Preview

    Learn More

    Unavailable Universal APIs

    Windows IoT Core is a work in progress. Here are the UWP APIs that have not been implemented yet on our platform.

    Learn More

    Compatible Peripheral USB Devices

    Find a list of USB devices compatible with Window 10 IoT Core devices

    Learn More

    Using WINDBG

    Use WINDBG to debug

    Learn More

    Glossary

    A list of commonly used phrases and their meanings

    Learn More

    Web-based Device Management

    Get advanced diagnostics about your machine from the web

    Learn More

    Headless UWP Apps

    Windows IoT Core can either be in headed or headless mode. The difference is the presence or absence of any form of UI

    Learn More

    Access your files using FTP

    Access the files on your device using FTP

    Learn More

    Access your files using Windows File Sharing

    Access the files on your device using Windows file sharing

    Windows 10 IoT Core Insider Preview

    Hello, World!

    Create a 'Hello World' application that runs on devices running Windows 10 IoT Core Insider Preview

    Hello World (C#)
    Hello World (Python)
    Hello World (Node.js)

    Hello Blinky (Headless App)

    Create an app with no UI that toggles an LED on devices running Windows 10 IoT Core Insider Preview

    Blinky (C#)
    Blinky (Python)

    UI Blinky App

    Create a UI-based app that toggles an LED on devices running Windows 10 IoT Core Insider Preview

    UI Blinky (C#/C++)

    Blinky Webserver

    Create a Webserver app that controls an LED on devices running Windows 10 IoT Core Insider Preview

    Webserver Blinky (C#)
    Webserver Blinky (Python)
    Webserver Blinky (Node.js)

    Console App

    Create a console app that monitors memory usage on devices running Windows 10 IoT Core Insider Preview

    Console App (C++)
    Console App (Node.js)

    I2C/SPI Accelerometer

    Create an app leveraging I2C or SPI on devices running Windows 10 IoT Core Insider Preview

    I2C Accelerometer (C#)
    SPI Accelerometer (C#)

    SPI Display

    Create an app using SPI on devices running Windows 10 IoT Core Insider Preview

    SPI Display (C#)

    AllJoyn Connectivity

    Learn more about AllJoyn and explore the capabilities of the AllJoyn Device System Bridge with Windows 10 IoT Core Insider Preview

    Learn More

    Driver Sample

    Create and interact with a universal driver on devices running Windows 10 IoT Core Insider Preview

    Driver Sample (C++)

    I2C Port Expander (RPi2 Basic Kit Lab)

    Raspberry Pi 2 Basic Kit Lab - Create an app that uses the Raspberry Pi 2 I2C bus to communicate with a port expander.

    I2C Port Expander (C#)

    Serial-In, Parallel-Out Shift Register (RPi2 Basic Kit Lab)

    Raspberry Pi 2 Basic Kit Lab - Create an app that uses the Raspberry Pi 2 to control LEDs using a serial-in, parallel-out shift register.

    Shift Register (C#)

    RGB LED (RPi2 Basic Kit Lab)

    Raspberry Pi 2 Basic Kit Lab - Create an app that uses the Raspberry Pi 2 to toggle an RGB LED.

    RGB LED (C#)

    Push Button(RPi2 Basic Kit Lab)

    Raspberry Pi 2 Basic Kit Lab - Create an app that uses the Raspberry Pi 2 to read the status of a Push Button and control an LED.

    Push Button (C#)

    Potentiometer Sensor Sample (RPi2 Basic Kit Lab)

    Raspberry Pi 2 Basic Kit Lab - A analog sensor is connected to RaspBerry Pi through ADC converter and digital output data is displayed through Monitor and LED

    Potentiometer Sensor Sample (C#)

    GpioTestTool (Console)

    This simple command line utility shows how to use the Gpio WinRT APIs from standard C++.

    GpioTestTool (C++)

    I2cTestTool (Console)

    This simple utility shows how to use C++/CX in command line programs.

    I2cTestTool (C++)

    SpiTestTool (Console)

    Write and read from SPI devices on the command line.

    SpiTestTool (C++)

    Express Node.js App (UWP)

    Create an Express Node.js app that runs on devices running Windows 10 IoT Core Insider Preview

    Express (Node.js)
